intro: Urostachys springii, commonly known as the spring saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It is a small perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant features basal leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or white, arranged in a dense cluster at the top of the stem. Urostachys springii is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions and is often found in high-altitude ecosystems.
